summary: The 'Count the Crimes to Cut Act of 2025' mandates reports on federal criminal offenses. The Attorney General must provide a list of criminal statutory offenses, detailing elements, penalties, prosecution numbers, and mens rea requirements. Federal agencies will also report on criminal regulatory offenses, including penalties, violations referred for prosecution, and mens rea. These lists are to be indexed and made publicly available. The legislation aims to increase transparency regarding federal criminal law and regulations.
